title: 'Highly flammable' bamboo scaffolding intensified Hong Kong fire, expert says | ABC NEWS
description: Fire safety expert Professor Guan Yeoh says bamboo scaffolding used in Chinese construction projects should be banned, after it fuelled the nation's deadliest fire in decades. At least 55 people have died after seven high-rise apartment towers in Hong Kong went up in flames, with hundreds still missing. title: 'Once-in-300-year' flood hits southern Thailand | ABC NEWS
description: Southern Thailand is still reeling from a 'one-in-300-years' rain deluge that has led to more than two dozen deaths. Officials say nearly 3 million people in Thailand have been impacted by the floods. Tens of thousands of people in the southern region have been evacuated. title: Banks face mortgage lending restrictions in 2026, ASX loses steam | Finance Report | ABC NEWS
description: The Australian Prudential Regulation Authority (APRA) will impose new restrictions on residential mortgage lending from February 2026, but it's unlikely to have any impact on house prices. title: Banking regulator to cap home loans amid housing boom | The Business | ABC NEWS
description: The banking regulator will impose new restrictions on home loans from early next year to limit the number of "high-risk" large loans being issued to customers. APRA is ordering the institutions under its supervision to limit high debt-to-income loans to 20 per cent of all new loans approved. The regulator says the 20 per cent cap will apply separately to investor and owner-occupier loans, to avoid the risk of investors "crowding out" owner-occupier buyers. A high debt-to-income loan is defined as one where the total amount borrowed is more than six times the borrower's annual household income. The new cap on high debt-to-income loans takes effect on February 1. Alicia Barry spoke with APRA chair, John Lonsdale, in his first TV interview. He says; "we're particularly targeting high debt to income lending, if we're successful at that, we'd expect good quality lending to keep happening through the economy and I think that's good for borrowers of all sorts."  #ABCBusiness Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE Read more here: https://www.abc.net.au/news/2025-11-27/banking-regulator-apra-imposes-home-loan-caps/106058604  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. description: Sweeping changes to the nation's environment laws are about to pass parliament after the prime minister sidelined the Coalition and struck a late-night deal with the Greens. description: Capping off a tumultuous final week in parliament, the former deputy prime minister, Barnaby Joyce, has quit the National Party, announcing he will go it alone on the crossbench. title: Death toll climbs, hundreds remain missing as Hong Kong fire smoulders | ABC NEWS
description: Several high-rise buildings in Hong Kong have continued smouldering more than 24 hours after a fire tore through a residential complex. The inferno quickly spread through seven tower blocks, fuelled by bamboo scaffolding erected for building renovations. At least 55 people have been killed, with hundreds still unaccounted for. Chinese authorities have arrested three construction company workers on suspicion of manslaughter. title: Ken Henry welcomes deal to reform Australia's ageing environment laws | The Business | ABC NEWS
description: Former treasury secretary, Ken Henry, now chair of the Australian Climate and Biodiversity Foundation, has celebrated the deal between Labor and the Greens to reform Australia's environment laws. He has told The Business it "demonstrates the Australian parliament is up to the task of serious economic reform that promotes prosperity." Dr Henry says the reforms put an end to what he calls' the false dichotomy between the economy and the environment.' He says, "for centuries, humans have believed that economic and social progress necessarily comes at the expense of the environment." Labor's deal with the Greens will see more federal oversight of forestry and land clearing, and no "fast-tracking" for coal and gas projects. Ken Henry says "I don't see these as concessions, I see these as improvements." The deal comes five years after an independent review from Graeme Samuel called for similar environmental reform. #ABCBusiness Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. It's news when you want it, from Australia's most trusted news organisation. title: Tourist killed in NSW shark attack, another seriously injured | ABC NEWS
description: A woman has been killed, and a man seriously injured, in a shark attack on the Mid North Coast in NSW. The international tourists in their 20s were helped by bystanders on the beach, but the woman died before paramedics arrived. Beaches in and around Crowdy Bay have been closed.  Experts believe a bull shark is responsible for the attack. title: Neuropsychologists disagree on murder-accused's mental state | ABC NEWS
description: NT Supreme Court jury members in the trial of Brendan Kantilla, the man accused of murdering an international student more than two years ago in Darwin, have heard conflicting evidence about the accused's mental capacity.  Mr Kantilla has pleaded not guilty to the murder of 23-year-old Bangladeshi man Isfaqur Rahman, with the defence arguing he had a substantial mental impairment at the time. title: What's causing record floods, typhoons in Thailand, Vietnam and Philippines? The World | ABC News
description: South-East Asia is enduring one of its worst rainy seasons on record, as extreme weather systems bring devastation to the region. Hundreds have been killed in the Philippines, Thailand, Malaysia, Vietnam and Indonesia where millions have been forced to evacuate from their homes. Emergency authorities and governments are under significant strain, with clean-up and relief efforts struggling to cope in the aftermath of typhoons, floods and landslides. Climatologist Fredolin Tangang spoke to The World's Girish Sawlani about what's behind the region's devastating monsoon season. #ABCTheWorld #ABCAsiaPacific  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Why a dormant Ethiopian volcano erupts after 12,000 years  | The World | ABC NEWS
description: A volcano in Ethiopia has erupted for the first time in nearly 12,000 years. The eruption of the Hayli Gubbi volcano sent thick plumes of smoke up to 14 kilometres into the sky, and across the Red Sea toward Yemen, Oman, and as far as northern India. Volcanologist Dr Heather Handley explained to The World's Girish Sawlani why the volcano suddenly became active again. #ABCTheWorld #ABCAsiaPacific  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad.
